questions.query: A foam filled fire extinguisher is recognized on which color and may be not used on what groups of materials?

options.text: A blue color and is should not be used on metal fires
A green color and it shall not be used on liquid fires
A yellow color and it shall not be used on electrical and metal fires
A blue color and it shall not be used on metal and/or electrical fires

questions.query: Fuel jettisoning shall not be performed unless safety in jeopardy. Amongst other rules a minimum level shall be used when dumping fuel, what level or altitude had to be observed?

options.text: 9000ft above build up areas, 6000ft over unpopulated areas, all AGL
9000ft AMSL outside build up areas, overhead build up areas ATC will inform the crew of the minimum altitude
6000ft AGL build up areas shall be avoided
6000ft AMSL during emergencies build areas shall not be considered

questions.query: During winter operations with heavy snow and ice accretion on the wings hold over time following de-icing shall approximately be:

options.text: 45 minutes in snow with temperaturs below zero
15 minutes in freezing fog with temperatures below -10C
10 minutes regardless of the weather type
5 minutes in snow with temperatures between 0 - -10C

questions.query: Wake turbulence categories may be defined based on MTOW and wing characteristics. What weights are used in the devidence of the groups A to G?

options.text: 136.000kgs and 18600kgs
136.000kgs and 7000kgs

questions.query: Which documents outlines the specifications for the packing of Dangerous Goods.

options.text: Operator's Operations Manual
ICAO Technical instructions
IATA Dangerous Goods Document
EASA Dangerous Goods Document

questions.query: Refer to the commercial aircraft operations. In which part of the operations manual would you find information about the policy and procedures of the use of TCAS  and ACAS ?

options.text: Part A
Part B
Part C
Part D

questions.query: Which items are allowed to be carried on board ?

options.text: Spare fuel cell cartridge , safety matches on one's person , 70% or less alcoholic beverages.s.
Organic peroxides , carbon dioxide , less then 2.5 kg dry ice.
Strike anywhere matches , smoke hood with oxygen supply , permeation devices for calibrating air quality monitoring equipment.
Spare fuel cell cartridge , mercury thermometer , liquid oxygen.

questions.query: When leaving the MNPS oceanic control area , the pilot has to :

options.text: Take any Mach number.
Take the Mach number specified in the initial flight plan.
Take the Mach number provided for this type of flight by his airline.
Maintain the Mach number previously assigned up to the last position shown in the oceanic clearnance.
